Frame:Government

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss Government
Transcription
Description
Closest FrameNet Frame(s) Leadership
Maps to IARPA Source Concept(s)
Other aliases
Comments A Governing entity (an official government institution) has exclusive legitimate authority to govern the people (governed) who are physically present in a particular geographic region (jurisdiction). The domain of authority includes a broad range of functional domains(governed-activities). For a given region/level of government, it is generally the case that a single 'government' governs that region (e.g. there are not competing state governments within a state).
Family Governance frames, Government frames
Tags
Type Frame
Cultural Scope
Cultural Information

Frame.CommentsA Governing entity (an official government …
A Governing entity (an official government institution) has exclusive legitimate authority to govern the people (governed) who are physically present in a particular geographic region (jurisdiction). The domain of authority includes a broad range of functional domains(governed-activities). For a given region/level of government, it is generally the case that a single 'government' governs that region (e.g. there are not competing state governments within a state).
